From: Kevin Ramsey <kramsey20@...>

Yeah but what I'm saying is that it's a lot better
than having to keep track of what 50 characters are
doing at once. I recommend either a tag system or a
SERIOUS cut-down on characters. I don't mean to sound
like I'm complaining, because I'm not. For instance
you, Yan have a buttload and a half of characters, 85%
of which probably don't have a purpose and a great
deal which I'm positive you never use. I'm all for
large-scale robot warfare, but this is just
ridiculous.

It annoys me having to waste space in my inbox full of
posts that say...


:::Optimus Prime:::

Smokes a doobie.


And that's it. That's the post. Would it not be
possible for anyone to y'know...not do separate posts
for 15 characters instead of devouring space in other
peoples' mailboxes with one-liners?

If nobody else has a problem with this, I'll shut up.






--- Yanshosh@... wrote:
> I don't think that's a good idea. I've seen RPGs
> with tags, and 
> they're kinda missing something. I can't really say
> what, but it 
> isn't as good as knowing what's going on everywhere.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kevin Ramsey <kramsey20@y...>
> wrote:
> > I agree. 
> > 
> > But is anybody else annoyed about having to read
> EVERY
> > message in your inbox only to find that about 75%
> of
> > what you read neither pertains to your
> > character/characters or has any interest to you at
> > all? (considering that my box fills up with an
> average
> > of 30 NBWRPG posts an hour, I'm willing to bet
> that at
> > least some of you don't have time to rifle through
> up
> > to 100 messages a day if you only have time to do
> > e-mail once or twice a day.). I wouldn't mind
> things
> > changing. Maybe a tag system where at the end of
> the
> > message everybody puts in parentheses say...(Tag:
> John
> > Doe) or something. Or maybe an Attention system in
> > every subject header, say...."Your Subject Header
> Here
> > (ATTN: Optimus Prime)". If something is REALLY
> > important, the subject header could be (ATTN:
> > Everyone). 
> > 
> > I remember being told shortly after I joined that
> the
> > current system is SUPPOSED to be so everybody has
> to
> > go through every message. But considering that
> most of
> > the posts here are one-liners and/or complete
> drivel
> > (that's not to say EVERY post are one-liners or
> drivel
> > though), doing that just seems like a
> Unicron-sized
> > waste of time.
> > 
> > 
> > Any thoughts anyone?
> > 
> > --- Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > >     As much as I enjoy watching pointless
> arguments,
> > > this could drive another 
> > > wedge between people in the group.  We don't
> need
> > > that.  Alten, as amusing as 
> > > the post was, it went beyond the bounds of good
> > > taste.  From an objective 
> > > perspective, Yan probably could have been less
> harsh
> > > but his point was valid.
> > > 
> > 
> >
